turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Bone tool.
turn.1: What are the types of awls used in beadwork?
turn.2: Bone awls vary considerably in the amount of polish from wear, the method of preparation, and size.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Bone awls tend to be classified according to the characteristics of the bone used to make the awl. Many bone awls that retain an epiphysis, or rounded end of a bone.
turn.5: What are the different uses of the awls?
turn.6: Although authors have differing theories as to the uses of bone awls, the two main uses agreed upon are as manipulators in the making of basketry and as perforators in the working of hide.
turn.7: Where did the awls come from?
turn.8: Bone spear points and bipoints have been found throughout the world.
turn.9: What are some of the types of awls?
turn.10: A mastodon rib bone found in Washington State was discovered in the 1970s with a broken bone projectile point stuck in it.
turn.11: How old were some of the awls?
turn.12: Recent radiocarbon dating reveals that it is about 14,000 years old.
